Description: Blue glazed composition shabti with a lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard, crossed hands in relief holding an adze, a hoe and the cord of a seed-basket which hangs over the shoulder, the front of the legs is inscribed with blue painted Hieroglyphs, now illegible, there is a shallow back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
